p: While these issues will emerge in different ways in different locations, one thing is clear—the most vulnerable members of society are bearing the brunt of the pandemic’s impact. People with underlying health conditions are particularly vulnerable to the effects of COVID19. Community mental health has been undermined by the isolation and uncertainty generated by the pandemic. In our globalised world, people are also more likely to be concerned for the well-being of family and other loved ones who are living or working in, or visiting, other countries.
